description: A  walk through Thamesmead's landscapes, including some less well-known hidden spaces. Led by Peabody's Director of Landscape, Dr Phil Askew.

events.name: Walking Tour of Thamesmead's Lost Landscape
events.notes: Join Phil Askew as he takes you on a walking tour through some of Thamesmead's lesser known and sometimes forgotten landscapes. Meeting in Cygnet Square, this tour takes between 90 and 120 mins.

events.name: Walking Tour of Thamesmead's Lost Landscape
events.notes: Join Phil Askew as he takes you on a walking tour through some of Thamesmead's lesser known and sometimes forgotten landscapes. Meeting in Cygnet Square, this tour takes between 90 and 120 mins.

factsheet.heading: Thamesmead's Lost Landscapes
paragraphs: Thamesmead is unusual within London in having an extensive 20th century planned landscape. It is one of the strongest remnants of the towns original Greater London Council (GLC) led masterplan and their planning for a new town within London in the 1960s.

Today one of Thamesmead's most loved features is its extensive landscape of parks and waterways including 5 lakes, 7km canals and over 150ha of greenspace – together these contribute to make Thamesmead unique.
Peabody is intent on improving the quality of Thamesmead's landscape and making it fit for the future.
Phil will take you on a tour of some of those lesser known landscapes and explain how Peabody is working to improve those spaces, encourage more people to visit and increase bio-diversity.

name: Thamesmead's Lost Landscapes
